page.title: 12The Local Gala
page.content: A gala is held in our village one weekend every year during the summer.The villagers meet at the club and then follow in a procession up the Main Street behind the gala queen.They parade through the streets and end up in Keir's Park.There are races for mums and dads,grans and grandads.There are running races for toddlers and upwards,obstacle races and a tug of war.Also during the summer is Cowdenbeath Civic Week.There is usually a fancy dress competition and all the entrants stand on lorries called floats which have streamers and rosettes and coloured ribbons hanging from them.The floats drive slowly down to Cowdenbeath Public Park with a brass band marching in front and everybody else follows at the back.Once at the park a gala is held.
